member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ArithmeticCompositeEffect
member.summary: Combines two images using a flexible equation that can be configured to perform computations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, or interpolation.

remarks.p: This effect combines two images using a weighted sum:
result = (Source1 * Source1Amount) + (Source2 * Source2Amount) + (Source1 * Source2 * MultiplyAmount) + Offset
Different settings of these coefficients can blend the images in many different ways, for instance:

list.item:
To add two images:
Source1Amount = 1
Source2Amount = 1
MultiplyAmount = 0
Offset = 0

To multiply two images:
Source1Amount = 0
Source2Amount = 0
MultiplyAmount = 1
Offset = 0

To subtract Source2 from Source1:
Source1Amount = 1
Source2Amount = -1
MultiplyAmount = 0
Offset = 0

To interpolate between Source1 and Source2 by amount 't':
Source1Amount = 1 - t
Source2Amount = t
MultiplyAmount = 0
Offset = 0

To invert Source1:
Source1Amount = -1
Source2Amount = 0
MultiplyAmount = 0
Offset = 1

remarks.p: This Windows Runtime type corresponds to the D2D Arithmetic composite effect.

member.summary: Weights how much the first image (Source1) should be included in the output image. Default value 0.

member.summary: Weights how much the second image (Source2) should be included in the output image. Default value 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ArithmeticCompositeEffect.Offset
member.summary: Adds a constant offset to the output image. Default value 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ArithmeticCompositeEffect.ClampOutput
member.summary: If set, the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before passing them on to the next effect in the graph. If false, the effect will not clamp values, although subsequent effects or the output surface may later clamp if they are not of high enough precision. Default value false.
